definition: to lose color/to fade/also pr. [diao4 shai3]

to fall/to drop/to lag behind/to lose/to go missing/to reduce/fall (in prices)/to lose (value, weight etc)/to wag/to swing/to turn/to change/to exchange/to swap/to show off/to shed (hair)/(used after certain verbs to express completion, fulfillment, removal etc)

sentences.english: If be the fade of little scope only, so complete and OK oneself are its complementary color .
sentences.chinese: 假如只是小范围的掉色，那么完全可以自己为它补色。

sentences.english: The railings on this side have just been whitewashed and can fade easily.
sentences.chinese: 这边的扶手才刚粉刷过，很容易掉色。

sentences.english: A; We'II dry-clean the dress. Then the color won't run.
sentences.chinese: 我们会干洗这条裙子，不会掉色的。

sentences.english: Be careful when you wash these clothes because the colours may bleed .
sentences.chinese: 洗这些衣服时小心点，因为可能会掉色。

sentences.english: The color from my red socks ran while I was washing.
sentences.chinese: 洗衣服的时候红袜子掉色。

sentences.english: If the colours are fast, you can wash the shirt in hot water.
sentences.chinese: 如果这件衬衫不掉色，你就可以用热水洗。

sentences.english: This skin color using a hot water so easily fade fades.
sentences.chinese: 这种皮色用开水一烫就轻易掉色变淡。

sentences.english: This side of the handrail was pointed just now, so it is easy to fade.
sentences.chinese: 这边的扶手才刚粉刷过，很容易掉色。

sentences.english: After a few washes, shapes become tweaked, colors fade, hems start to fringe.
sentences.chinese: 洗几次后，衣服变形，掉色，边缘开线。

sentences.english: Coloured cloth often fades when it is washed.
sentences.chinese: 染色的布洗后通常要掉色。

sentences.english: I am afraid the colour ran when I washed your new skirt.
sentences.chinese: 很遗憾，你那条新裙子我洗的时候掉色了。

sentences.english: Another minus is that if you are fair-haired, this shampoo may darken the color of your hair.
sentences.chinese: 另个个就是如果你时金发可能会让你的头发掉色。

sentences.english: The colours in this dress won't run if you wash it.
sentences.chinese: 这件连衣裙搓洗时不会掉色。

sentences.english: My blue T-shirt faded after I washed it several times.
sentences.chinese: 洗了几次后我的蓝色T恤掉色了。

definition: to lose color/to turn pale/to bleach/to fade
variant of 褪色[tui4 se4]/also pr. [tui4 shai3]
to peel off (paint)/(fig.) to be exposed/to lose face (Tw)
